references.paper_title: Gradient Flows: In Metric Spaces and in the Space of Probability Measures
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational mathematical framework for understanding Wasserstein gradient flows, which are central to the theoretical analysis of the KKL divergence and its optimization.
This is the original paper introducing the kernel Kullback-Leibler divergence, which is the primary focus of the current paper.
This paper introduces the MMD gradient flow, a closely related method for comparing probability distributions, providing a baseline for comparison with the proposed regularized KKL.

references.paper_title: General state space Markov chains and MCMC algorithms
references.reason: This paper provides background on Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods, a crucial technique used for approximating probability distributions, relevant to the broader context of the current paper.

This book is a comprehensive reference on optimal transport theory, which is fundamental to the understanding of Wasserstein distances and gradient flows, providing a theoretical foundation for the work.
